document_data.name: Coast of Cormyr
document_data.mainbody: The '''Coast of Cormyr''' was an informal region of the kingdom that consisted of the rural lands along the coast of the [[Dragonmere]]. Though home to the oldest [[human]] settlements in [[Cormyr]], much of the coastal region remained a lightly-inhabited countryside of hidden villages and old, forgotten ruins.
document_data.Description: The coast was a stretch of pastoral lands east of the kingdom's [[Heartlands of Cormyr|heartlands]] and south of the [[East Reaches of Cormyr|east reaches]] frontier, with many villages and hamlets but few towns. It largely consisted of rolling plains interspersed with small valleys and woodlands, the largest of which was the [[Hermit's Wood]], and was watered by many rivers, streams, and marshlands. The lightly-populated coastline had plenty of coves and beaches suitable for landings, making it popular with smugglers and pirates despite the best efforts of the [[Blue Dragons]] and [[Purple Dragons]].

Geography.Bodies of Water:
* The [[Darkflow River]] emerged from the [[Vast Swamp]] and flowed into the [[Dragonmere]], forming the border between Sembia and Cormyr.
* The [[Starwater River]] primarily flowed through the [[Cormyr/Heartlands|Heartlands]], but formed part of the western border of the Coast as it turned towards the sea.
* The [[River Mistwater]] was fed by the [[Evenbrook]] and [[Kirinar Stream]] before flowing into the Dragonmere.
* The [[Wyvernflow]] passed from the [[Wyvernwater]] in the north, bisecting the coastal region and allowing trade and travel to and from the interior of Cormyr.
Geography.Territories:
* [[Starwater]], an earldom east of Marsember across the Starwater.{{Cite dragon annual/2000/After the Dragon: The Kingdom of Cormyr Today|66}}
* The [[Windcoast]], the farmlands of House [[Arcantlet]] east of the Wyvernflow.{{Cite web/Candlekeep forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2009)/House Arcantlet}}

Notable Locations.Settlements:
* [[Battlerise]], a hamlet just east of the [[Darkflow River]] and [[Sembia]], below the ruins of [[Battlegate]].
* [[Blustich]], a small village between the [[Hermit's Wood]] and Wyvernflow.
* [[Bogbrook]], a farming village near the Starwater, notorious for its country bumpkins.
* [[Dawngleam]], a coastal town and easternmost harbor in the realm.
* [[Dreamer's Rock]], a village in the lee of the hill of the same name north of the [[Way of the Manticore]].
* [[Gladehap]], a prosperous village in the wooded valley of [[Lost Lake]].
* [[Gorthin]], a hamlet north of Kirinwood amid bogs that fed into the [[Evenbrook]].
* [[Heldul's Rest]], a waystop along the Way of the Manticore east of Wheloon.{{Cite dungeon/194/Eye on the Realms: Thormil's Secret|2}}
* [[Kallamarn]], a farming village on the bank of the Starwater.
* [[Kirinwood]], a large village on the [[Kirinar Stream]].
* [[Moonever]], a fishing village at the east side of the Starwater's mouth.
* [[Monksblade]], a hamlet founded on the ruins of four monasteries.
* [[Nesmyth]], a troubled, environmentally-disastrous village north of Marsember.
* [[Ongul's Water]], a placid village on a small lake near the Starwater.
* [[Smuggler's Stone]], a small fishing village historically favored by smugglers.
* [[Wheloon]], a large town on the [[Wyvernflow]] river.
* [[Wormtower]], an obscure village notable for its destroyed wizard tower and [[dragon]] skeleton.
Notable Locations.Landmarks & Ruins:
* [[Battlegate]], a ruined castle atop a hill near [[Battlerise]], former home of the [[Auantiver]] family.
* [[Eastbridge]], the bridge over the Darkflow River that crossed into the [[Westward]] of Sembia.
* [[Marsark's Grove]], a site north of Wheloon near a [[slate]] quarry.
* [[Netherese portal (Cormyr)|Netherese portal]], an ancient ''[[portal]]'' built upon by a temple of [[Tyche]] that became Monksblade.{{Cite dungeon/88/The Door from Everywhere|33}}
Notable Locations.Roads & Trails:
* The [[Blister Trail]], a path that followed the shore of Wyvernwater between [[Immersea]] and Wheloon.
* The [[Bluemist Trail]], a long trail that ran along the coast of the [[Dragonmere]] through Dawngleam and up the Darkflow River.
* The [[Mistwood Trail]], a country road that ran from Dawngleam to Wheloon.
* The [[Water Trail]], a path that went from Kirinwood across the border of [[Sembia]] to [[Seaspring]] and [[Nolin]].
* The [[Way of the Manticore]], a major highway that ran east from [[Hilp]] through [[Wheloon]] into Sembia.
